description: After the installation of the security update KB5039212 on affected systems, users may experience unexpected behaviors such as application crashes or system instabilities. Systems running Windows 10 builds including 10.0.19043.4529, 10.0.22631.3737, and earlier versions may exhibit increased vulnerability to unauthorized remote code execution. This can manifest as instances where the system fails to respond properly to user inputs, possibly leading to denial of service scenarios. End users might notice applications unexpectedly terminating or error messages indicating that the software is unable to execute commands. Affected platforms include Windows Server 2016 and various Windows 10 versions, making it crucial for system administrators to monitor for these symptoms post-update.
